item.title: Persona 5: The Phantom X is the Ultimate Character Design Permission Slip for Persona 6
item.description:
Atlus has not officially unveiled Persona 6, but it has already taken steps that hint at deeper changes. Persona 5: The Phantom X , the new mobile and PC spin-off, introduces Chizuko Nagao, codename Vino, who is a 75-year-old Phantom Idol and playable character. This marks the first instance in the Persona franchise of a character in that age range who can fight alongside the player.

Chizuko Nagao in Persona 5: The Phantom X is not a side character or minor support. She is fully playable with the Persona Ampelos and assigned the saboteur role using nuclear damage type, making her more than a cameo or novelty. Her backstory includes being forthright, heavy drinking habits, dependable reliability, and difficulty communicating with her granddaughter, who plays a key emotional role in her life. It's too early to say with certainty, but this character breaking tradition in such a bold way represents a fundamental shift in voice for character design and may indicate future changes in core Persona titles.

Persona 5: The Phantom X Expands Age Boundaries for Person a

In Persona 5: The Phantom X , Chizuko Nagao joins younger Phantom Thieves in a way the mainline entries never allowed, with her presence challenges the long-standing pattern that only high school-age protagonists and cohorts are playable. In previous main Persona games, adults appeared as mentors or NPCs but never joined the fight in a meaningful way. Here, Vino brings lived history and emotional layers tied to legacy, redemption, and generational reflection. If nothing else, her inclusion implies Atlus is curious about expanding character archetypes beyond adolescence.

With older playable characters in a mainline game, Persona 6 could explore emotional arcs grounded in age and experience. A 75-year-old Persona user might symbolize grief processed over decades or regret at final chance redemption, guiding a younger protagonist or confronting issues that only time brings. That tone is rare in JRPG protagonist groups, and Vino is proof that a mature perspective can integrate with supernatural conflict.

Up to now, Persona mentor figures like Sojiro or Dojima never took up weapons themselves.

Persona 6 Setting and Rumored Themes Support Older Characters

Speculation suggests that the enduring focus on Persona high school stories may shift toward college or early adulthood. That transition opens natural space for characters in their late twenties, thirties, or older. If the game includes clubs, internships, or part-time work, the cast will logically include adults. Thus, a character like Vino would be unprecedented; for example, a former detective or retired Persona user rejoining battle, a community elder getting involved due to personal stakes, or a former musician whose past trauma becomes story fuel.

Moreover, the franchise expanding life simulation systems, such as cafe mini-games or gardening, suggests new layers of everyday mechanics. Adding multi-generational party members could enrich social interaction systems where a grandparent or otherwise elderly character might mentor others, influence daily routines, or host downtime activities. That type of design would build on recent journeys in franchise comfort and downtime focus.

Persona spin-off titles have increasingly experimented with relaxed rhythms in daily life design, and a mature playable character fits without contradiction.

Persona 5: The Phantom X Sets the Stage for Personaâ€™s New Era

Persona 5: The Phantom X shows that Atlus is willing to break the established franchise format without an extreme narrative overhaul. The game mixes ages, backgrounds, and Personas without canonical justification beyond thematic intent. That may signal that not only could Persona 6 follow a less rigid structure, but it might also abandon the strict school year timeframe and limited age group format for a more flexible timeline or party composition style.

Allowing older fighting party members reframes themes of identity and purpose. It indicates Atlus may treat age as an asset, not a limit. The series could shift focus from teenage rebellion to adult legacy and lived consequences, for instance, and that opens storytelling possibilities like confronting mortality or long-term personal impact.

Chizuko Nagao started something awesome, and Atlus should continue to let that change blossom. If Persona 6 includes such changes, the entire tone of the series could shift:

  • Day-to-day life scenes would follow new routines.
  • Social links and bonds in Persona 6 may span generations.
  • Story conflicts could involve issues like caregiving, retirement, family legacy, or community leadership.

item.title: Fortnite Reveals New Weapon for Chapter 6 Season 4
item.description:
Fortnite has officially revealed a brand-new weapon coming to the battle royale for its next season, adding the Swarmstrike as a new rocket launcher. The massively popular shooter from Epic Games has introduced a wide variety of different weapons for players to take into battle, often featuring weapons with unique mechanics and usages. From handguns to rocket launchers and even collab weapons like the Kamehameha from Dragon Ball Z and My Hero Academia 's Deku Smash, Fortnite fans have no shortage of different guns to choose from. Now, Fortnite is rolling out a new rocket launcher for its next season.

Fortnite 's Chapter 6 Season 4 looks to have lots of exciting content on the way, particularly with its highlighted collaboration. Epic Games officially confirmed Chapter 6 Season 4's flagship crossover content, welcoming a collaboration with Halo set to arrive to Fortnite on August 7. Epic Games has also hinted at a particularly notable crossover coming to the game, bringing skins based on Power Rangers . Fortnite is now teasing a brand-new weapon coming as part of the game's next season.

Fortnite officially revealed the Swarmstrike as a brand-new weapon coming to the game with the launch of Chapter 6 Season 4. The Swarmstrike appears to be a new type of rocket launcher, likely featuring some kind of spread fire as a part of its functionality. The new Fortnite weapon is said to be an effective way to "clear the next infestation," potentially hinting at a new mechanic or gameplay feature coming as part of the next season. The Swarmstrike and Fortnite 's Chapter 6 Season 4 update are officially scheduled to launch on August 7.

Fortnite Adding New Weapon in Chapter 6 Season 4

The addition of the Swarmstrike will join lots more new content rumored to be coming to different game modes. The popular Blitz Royale mode is rumored to be adding one of Fortnite 's most iconic points of interest, with leaks suggesting that Tilted Towers will soon be added to the fast-paced game mode. Blitz Royale also recently received two brand-new game modes, adding a six-man squad mode with "Six Stack" and "Pure Chaos" with increased siphon and more skilled opponents.

Fortnite fans should expect plenty of fanfare to come with the launch of the battle royale's new season. Fortnite will kick off a brand-new battle pass with Chapter 6 Season 4, with leaks hinting at a Megazord skin and more from the previously-mentioned Power Rangers crossover. Epic Games also hinted at new changes coming to the in-game map as part of the new season, with each new season typically bringing significant alterations to the battlefield. Epic Games looks to be bringing lots to Fortnite 's newest season to excite any fan of the game.

item.title: Sandbox Game With â€˜Very Positiveâ€™ Reviews Passes Impressive Milestone on Steam
item.description:
A Game About Digging a Hole , which is exactly what it sounds like, has hit a surprising sales goal, surpassing one million copies sold nearly six months after its release on Steam. The gameplay loop of A Game About Digging a Hole is simplistic, and clearly quite addictive, considering the number of people who have picked it up and the positive reviews they've left.

Steam's cumulative user reviews for A Game About Digging a Hole have it sitting in the "Very Positive" category, with 89 percent of the more than 14,000 players who have left a review giving it their approval. While certainly not hitting blockbuster numbers, it's still managing peaks of more than 300 concurrent players within the last week, and when it was released in early February, managed to make its way near the top of Steam's most popular new games list.

A Game About Digging A Hole Surpasses 1 Million Sales

In a recent post on the game's community page on Steam, one-person developer DoubleBee expressed thanks to everyone who has played A Game About Digging a Hole , noting that their support has recently helped the game to reach one million units sold. Despite several copycat games that have emerged since its initial success, many fans believe A Game About Digging a Hole to be one of the best sandbox games on Steam, and the announcement has been met with a lot of congratulations from its most loyal fans.

While the game has seen massive success on Steam, DoubleBee also announced that the game is branching out to new platforms, as it is now available on iOS and Android devices through the App Store and Google Play Store, respectively. Additionally, the developer's note states that an external team is working on porting the game to other, unspecified platforms. That announcement has sparked a little dismay among players who have already collected all of A Game About Digging a Hole 's achievements and are worried that no new content will be coming, but the majority of fans seem to be reveling in the game's success and waiting to see where the game goes next.

As for what's next for DoubleBee, they're currently sticking with their simplistic naming conventions and working on a solarpunk game called Solarpunk . Planned for release sometime before the end of 2025, Solarpunk will be a peaceful open-world survival crafting game that will let players grow food, build gadgets, and use an airship to explore islands in the sky alone or with friends. There's no firm release date yet, but alpha/beta testing is expected to start soon.

item.title: Missing Cows Quest Guide in Titan Quest 2
item.description:
A lot of main quests and side quests are clearly marked on the map in Titan Quest 2 , making them easy to complete and great sources of easy or rare items. Other quests, specifically side quests, are much less clear and don't offer many hints or exact locations to search, though these quests are still very worthwhile to complete.

Completing quests is one of the easiest ways to level up fast, so taking the time to find a quest objective can usually be better than just grinding random enemies for XP. The quest Missing Cows does have a section early on that will have players searching around for the missing cows; here's where to find them.

Where to Find the Missing Cows in Titan Quest 2

Issa will mention that the cows escaped from their pens and headed south, though there are multiple paths out of the Enclave to the south. You'll want to start at the waypoint in the Enclave and take the path south that's to the right of that waypoint. Follow the main road past the other section of the enclave with refugees, taking the second opening path down into the grass that leads to the swamp.

Continue through the swamp south, and you'll pass by two of the cows that have been killed, though you won't have to do anything with them. The path is fairly narrow, and you'll eventually come across the three cows just standing around. Interact with them to make them follow you as you head back to Stolos' to continue the quest.

New monsters will spawn on your way back to camp, through nothing that dangerous.

Finishing Missing Cows & The Reward For the Quest in Titan Quest 2

After returning the cows to Stolos, you'll learn more about the feud and be tasked with finding Old Man Thon, who is located southeast of the Enclave . A small area is marked on your map for where to find him, but you can head to the dead center of that area to find him. After doing so, the last few parts of the quest are simple:

  • Return to Issa
  • Agree to talk to Stolos with the group
  • Give Stolos the potion

Doing so will finish the Missing Cows quest, giving you 3,962 XP to level up, and the satisfaction that things in the Enclave are better, though no rare items or gear are given along with it.

item.title: Roblox: MUGEN Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All MUGEN Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for MUGEN
  • How to Get More MUGEN Codes

There are plenty of great anime games on Roblox , but MUGEN is arguably one of the very best. It's a swordfighting battleground game with an incredible combat system and multiple fighting styles for players to choose from. Players can spin for new styles if they want to, although doing so may come at a cost.

Although the game features monetization, players can still have a good time without spending any money, either by grinding or by using MUGEN codes. The latter will reward Roblox players with a bunch of free spins and other in-game goodies, so they should be sure to redeem them whenever they get the chance.

Updated August 3, 2025, by Tom Bowen: The Mist Style Update just dropped, and with it, three new MUGEN codes. By redeeming MISTUPDATE , SORRY4DELAY , and BIGCODE , players can get 23 Lucky Spins, 30 Spins, and Â¥25,000. After doing so, they should take a moment or two to bookmark this page so that they can check back here regularly, as we're constantly on the lookout for new codes for MUGEN and will update the list below with any that we find.

All MUGEN Codes

Working MUGEN Codes

  • BIG CODE - Redeem code for 15 Lucky Spins, 30 Spins, and Â¥10,000 (NEW)
  • MISTUPDATE - Redeem code for 5 Lucky Spins and Â¥10,000 (NEW)
  • SORRY4DELAY - Redeem code for 3 Lucky Spins and Â¥5,000 (NEW)
  • AWAKENINGS - Redeem code for 8 Lucky Spins
  • SRRYSRRY - Redeem code for 8 Lucky Spins
  • MUGENSBACK - Redeem code for 10 Lucky Spins
  • THUNDER - Redeem code for 4 Lucky Spins
  • PATCHMEUP - Redeem code for 5 Lucky Spins and Â¥5,000
  • THANKS100k - Redeem code for 5 Lucky Spins and Â¥10,000
  • RELEASE - Redeem code for 5 Lucky Spins and Â¥10,000
  • TESTING - Redeem code for 10 Normal Spins and 5 Lucky Spins

If any of the active MUGEN codes aren't working, players should try redeeming them on a new server.

Expired MUGEN Codes

  • PLAYTEST - Redeem code for 10 Normal Spins

How to Redeem Codes for MUGEN

The process for redeeming MUGEN codes is incredibly straightforward and one that should feel fairly familiar to those who've played other battlegrounds games on Roblox . To claim their rewards, players will simply need to press the Codes button on the left side of the main menu and then type or paste one of the working MUGEN codes into the Enter Code box before hitting Redeem.

  1. Launch MUGEN .
  2. Press the Codes button on the left side of the main menu.
  3. Type or paste one of the working codes for MUGEN into the Enter Code box.
  4. Press the green Redeem button.

How to Get More MUGEN Codes

The best place to find all of the latest MUGEN codes is right here, as we'll update the list above whenever new codes are added. That said, players may also want to check out the game's official Discord server and the Pure Pure Roblox community, as new codes are sometimes revealed there first before anywhere else.

  • Official MUGEN Discord Server
  • Pure Pure Roblox Community
